UML:TaggedValue.value: Description The system should be able to re-emit the high-priority messages after a timeout and drop the low-priority ones after a timeout. Measure to check High prority messages are not lost Rationale The system should support different delivery mechanism depending the type of the message Reference WP: 2,4 Ranking: 2

Description Ubiquitous (Secure) Connectivity: Access to communication services shall be provided by the architecture. Measure to check It is possible to access the system independent of the location. Rationale Access to architecture services or applications should not be restricted to dedicated places. Reference GENESYS R2.2.4.2 WP: 1,2 Ranking: 5

Description Well established protocol standards shall be supported by the architecture (e.g., Ethernet, USB, CAN, Bluetooth,...) Measure to check Communication is based on an established standard. Rationale Established protocol standards enable interoperability with existing systems. Reference GENESYS R2.2.1.8, PERSONA R2.2.1.7 WP: 1,2 Ranking: 5

Description Streaming of data (sound during voice call, images, videoconference etc) shall be supported by the architecture. The architecture should at least provide a way to setup separate transmission channels. Measure to check Streaming data can be consumed while it is not fully received. Rationale Many applications require the streaming of data (e.g., surveillance system with cameras), which can be consumed while it is delivered. Reference GENESYS R2.2.1.4, MPOWER R2.2.1.3, PERSONA R2.2.1.5, R2.2.1.6, R2.2.1.5 WP: 1,2 Ranking: 4.5

UML:ClassifierRole.name: Communication might be initiated and cancel by everyone

UML:TaggedValue.value: Description All paticipants might need to initiate and cancel contact Measure to check In the 100% of the system communications, any part (intervenient or actor) of a communivation shall be able to initiate his/her participating and ending it. Rationale The system shall be configured to make all participants able to initiate and stop the communication Reference WP: 4 Ranking: 4.5

Description Sharing of the physical communication infrastructure among multiple subsystems shall be supported by the architecture. Measure to check The communication infrastructure can be connected to multiple subsystems. Rationale Fewer hardware components, communication busses, cables and connectors are required to interconnect distinct subsystems, which is more cost-effective and increases the dependability of the system. Reference GENESYS R2.2.1.6 WP: 1,2 Ranking: 5

Description For the messages of a given subsystem guarantees of the lower bound on the communication bandwidth, upper bounds on the latency and jitter shall be determinable. Measure to check Bounds for resource utilization of each subsystem can be determinded. Rationale Resource utilization of subsystems that share the same communication infrastructure has to be bounded, especially in the worst-case scenario, in order to ensure the reliability of subsystems. Reference GENESYS R2.2.1.7 WP: 2 Ranking: 3

Description At network level control loops of applications shall be supported. Applications involving control loops, where sensing elements and actuators reside on different nodes, require predictable communication delay and jitter. Fixed timing of control loops (sensing, processing, acting), Measure to check The network supports the transport of messages with guaranteed bandwidth and jitter. It can be used for diagniosis of health status of components Rationale The control loop is used for diagniosis of health status of components Reference GENESYS R2.2.1.1, PERSONA R2.2.1.9 WP: 1,2,4 Ranking: 2.5

Description Utilization of functionality (also known as service utilization) takes place in a goal-based way if requests simply express the meaning of what is requested to be achieved and hence both addressing concrete target components and using syntactical artifacts, such as interfaces, can be avoided. That is, goal-based interoperability can be achieved when in communication there is no dependency onÂ technical details of the "how"s, but participants just focus on the "what"s. Measure to check Components of the system are able to ask for a goal, and the system will recognize who are the components that are needed for achieving the goal and the system contact them Rationale support goal-based communication, like requesting a certain goal-state that has to be accomplish, e.g. request that all lights in a certain room have to be turned on. Reference derived from analysis of self-organizing systems introduced by the German projects Sodapop & DynAMITE; see also ARTEMIS SRA for self-organization WP: 1,2,4 Ranking: 4

Description Communication services that tolerate delays/disruption shall be provided by the architecture also by using back-up systems. Delays and disruption cannot be completely eliminated (e.g., wireless networks). Measure to check Delay or disruption within the network does not lead to the failure of the corresponding subsystems. Rationale In case of temporary failure of the communication media the system should be able to use other communication media for communicating with other nodes of AAL spaces Reference GENESYS R2.2.1.3 WP: 1,2 Ranking: 3.5

Description support seamless connectivity in the distributed AmI environment underlying AAL systems, like, for example, nodes that find each other and connect in a dynamic way and can use the connections to communicate in an appropriate way Measure to check For the system the communication link is not important for allow the communication between two nodes as long as they share link, each nodes of the system should also discover other nodes which share a link with him and be aware when such nodes leaves Rationale Seamless connectivity is given if nodes participating in an open distributed system find each other and connect in a dynamic way and can use the connections to communicate in an appropriate way. Seamless connectivity is especially appropriate for AmI systems because they provide a boundary for such automatism per se due to being bound to a certain locality. Reference derived from analysis of self-organizing systems introduced by the German projects Sodapop & DynAMITE; see also ARTEMIS SRA for self-organization and seamless connectivity WP: 1,2 Ranking: 5

Description The network shall recognize network enviroment and network changes, i.e. when the AP moves among Wi-Fi hotsposts, the system should provide meccanism for a seamless migration among the hotspots Measure to check Netowrk enviroment is cached and monitored, thus any change to the network enviroment can be reliably detected. Rationale At link establishment and during execution, authentication has to be assured and used for personalization. Modifications of network addresses or links have to be detected. Reference GENESYS R2.2.1.9, MPOWER R2.2.1.4, PERSONA R2.2.1.11, R2.2.1.12 WP: 2 Ranking: 3.5

UML:ClassifierRole.name: Simultaneous support for axiomatized and light-wight ontologies

UML:TaggedValue.value: Description Simultaneous deployment of both formal axiomatized ontologies with rich semantics and light-weight ontologies, as appropriate for defining the content of the messages between nodes Measure to check The system can use at the same time both kinds of ontologies Rationale Formal ontologies can be exploited in complex reasoning tasks about situation data, light-weight ontologies can be exploited in automatic interface generation and to facilitate shared understanding Reference OASIS R2.2.2.1 WP: 2 Ranking: 3

Description The system should provide support for the environment of medical electronic data interchange (EDI) Measure to check The system is complaint with EDI specification and pass the EDI conformance tools Rationale EDI is extremely heterogeneous and complex, and it is changing continuously. Reference MPOWER R2.2.7.1 WP: 2,4 Ranking: 2

Description The transfer of messages based on the occurrence of an event with guaranteed bandwidth and latency shall be supported by the architecture. Measure to check The transmission of messages can be restricted to the occurrence of events. Rationale In many applications messages only need to be sent when an event occurs, which allowes optimized resource utilization. To improve quality-of-serivce guarantees of latency and bandwidth are needed Reference GENESYS R2.2.1.5, PERSONA R2.2.1.4,R2.2.1.8 MPOWER R2.2.1.5 WP: 1,2 Ranking: 5

Description enforcing the usage of uniform communication protocols by all modules participating in an AAL system facilitates the modular design of the system in which many design priciples can be shared both at the platform and at the application layer Measure to check Nodes composing the system comunicates by means of the uniform commmunication protocol Rationale AAL system is usally a distributed system which runs on different nodes. All the nodes should be able to communicate each other Reference ditto WP: 1,2 Ranking: 5

Description A Quality of Service for the communication of the systems should be available, the system should support: dynamic bandwidth allocation controlled activelly by the application level or inferred upon the communication of the application, real-time message transfer(i.e. for critical services, such as emegency services), data-streaming Measure to check When needed, communication bandwidth can be reserved for a subsystem, unused bandwidth is released. Rationale Different service of the systems may need a garantee level of the communication (i.e. critical services ) Reference GENESYS R2.2.1.10 WP: 1,2 Ranking: 2.5
